papers-2015-2025.title: Where's My Data? Evaluating Visualizations with Missing Data
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Many real-world datasets are incomplete due to factors such as data collection failures or misalignments between fused datasets. Visualizations of incomplete datasets should allow analysts to draw conclusions from their data while effectively reasoning about the quality of the data and resulting conclusions. papers-2015-2025.title: A Framework for Externalizing Implicit Error Using Visualization
papers-2015-2025.abstract: This paper presents a framework for externalizing and analyzing expert knowledge about discrepancies in data through the use of visualization. Grounded in an 18-month design study with global health experts, the framework formalizes the notion of data discrepancies as implicit error, both in global health data and more broadly. papers-2015-2025.abstract: Preattentive visual features such as hue or flickering can effectively draw attention to an object of interest – for instance, an important feature in a scientific visualization. papers-2015-2025.title: Recirculation Surfaces for Flow Visualization
papers-2015-2025.abstract: We present a formal approach to the visual analysis of recirculation in flows by introducing recirculation surfaces for 3D unsteady flow fields. papers-2015-2025.title: Objective Vortex Corelines of Finite-sized Objects in Fluid Flows
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Vortices are one of the most-frequently studied phenomena in fluid flows. papers-2015-2025.title: Interactive Visualization of RNA and DNA Structures
papers-2015-2025.abstract: The analysis and visualization of nucleic acids (RNA and DNA) is playing an increasingly important role due to their fundamental importance for all forms of life and the growing number of known 3D structures of such molecules. papers-2015-2025.title: Labels on Levels: Labeling of Multi-Scale Multi-Instance and Crowded 3D Biological Environments
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Labeling is intrinsically important for exploring and understanding complex environments and models in a variety of domains. papers-2015-2025.title: Visualization of Large Molecular Trajectories
papers-2015-2025.abstract: The analysis of protein-ligand interactions is a time-intensive task. Researchers have to analyze multiple physico-chemical properties of the protein at once and combine them to derive conclusions about the protein-ligand interplay. papers-2015-2025.title: Visual Analysis of Aneurysm Data using Statistical Graphics
papers-2015-2025.abstract: This paper presents a framework to explore multi-field data of aneurysms occurring at intracranial and cardiac arteries by using statistical graphics. papers-2015-2025.title: Interactive Visualization of 3D Histopathology in Native Resolution
papers-2015-2025.abstract: We present a visualization application that enables effective interactive visual analysis of large-scale 3D histopathology, that is, high-resolution 3D microscopy data of human tissue. papers-2015-2025.title: Visualization of Neuronal Structures in Wide-Field Microscopy Brain Images
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Wide-field microscopes are commonly used in neurobiology for experimental studies of brain samples. Available visualization tools are limited to electron, two-photon, and confocal microscopy datasets, and current volume rendering techniques do not yield effective results when used with wide-field data. papers-2015-2025.title: Interactive obstruction-free lensing for volumetric data visualization
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Occlusion is an issue in volumetric visualization as it prevents direct visualization of the region of interest. papers-2015-2025.title: Dynamic Volume Lines: Visual Comparison of 3D Volumes through Space-filling Curves
papers-2015-2025.abstract: The comparison of many members of an ensemble is difficult, tedious, and error-prone, which is aggravated by often just subtle differences. In this paper, we introduce Dynamic Volume Lines for the interactive visual analysis and comparison of sets of 3D volumes. papers-2015-2025.title: A Declarative Grammar of Flexible Volume Visualization Pipelines
papers-2015-2025.abstract: This paper presents a declarative grammar for conveniently and effectively specifying advanced volume visualizations. papers-2015-2025.title: Visualization of Bubble Formation in Porous Media
papers-2015-2025.abstract: We present a visualization approach for the analysis of CO2 bubble-induced attenuation in porous rock formations. As a basis for this, we introduce customized techniques to extract CO2 bubbles and their surrounding porous structure from X-ray computed tomography data (XCT) measurements. papers-2015-2025.title: Gaia Sky: Navigating the Gaia Catalog
papers-2015-2025.abstract: In this paper, we present Gaia Sky, a free and open-source multiplatform 3D Universe system, developed since 2014 in the Data Processing and Analysis Consortium framework of ESA's Gaia mission. papers-2015-2025.title: Interactive 3D Visual Analysis of Atmospheric Fronts
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Atmospheric fronts play a central role in meteorology, as the boundaries between different air masses and as fundamental features of extra-tropical cyclones. papers-2015-2025.title: An Interactive Framework for Visualization of Weather Forecast Ensembles
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Numerical Weather Prediction (NWP) ensembles are commonly used to assess the uncertainty and confidence in weather forecasts. Spaghetti plots are conventional tools for meteorologists to directly examine the uncertainty exhibited by ensembles, where they simultaneously visualize isocontours of all ensemble members. papers-2015-2025.title: Robust and Fast Extraction of 3D Symmetric Tensor Field Topology
papers-2015-2025.abstract: 3D symmetric tensor fields appear in many science and engineering fields, and topology-driven analysis is important in many of these application domains, such as solid mechanics and fluid dynamics. papers-2015-2025.title: DT-MRI Streamsurfaces Revisited
papers-2015-2025.abstract: DT-MRI streamsurfaces, defined as surfaces that are everywhere tangential to the major and medium eigenvector fields, have been proposed as a tool for visualizing regions of predominantly planar behavior in diffusion tensor MRI. papers-2015-2025.title: Tensor Field Visualization using Fiber Surfaces of Invariant Space
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Scientific visualization developed successful methods for scalar and vector fields. For tensor fields, however, effective, interactive visualizations are still missing despite progress over the last decades. papers-2015-2025.title: Culling for Extreme-Scale Segmentation Volumes: A Hybrid Deterministic and Probabilistic Approach
papers-2015-2025.abstract: With the rapid increase in raw volume data sizes, such as terabyte-sized microscopy volumes, the corresponding segmentation label volumes have become extremely large as well. papers-2015-2025.title: CPU Isosurface Ray Tracing of Adaptive Mesh Refinement Data
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) is a key technology for large-scale simulations that allows for adaptively changing the simulation mesh resolution, resulting in significant computational and storage savings. papers-2015-2025.title: Persistence Atlas for Critical Point Variability in Ensembles
papers-2015-2025.abstract: This paper presents a new approach for the visualization and analysis of the spatial variability of features of interest represented by critical points in ensemble data. papers-2015-2025.title: Probabilistic Asymptotic Decider for Topological Ambiguity Resolution in Level-Set Extraction for Uncertain 2D Data
papers-2015-2025.abstract: We present a framework for the analysis of uncertainty in isocontour extraction. papers-2015-2025.title: Hexahedral Mesh Structure Visualization and Evaluation
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Understanding hexahedral (hex-) mesh structures is important for a number of hex-mesh generation and optimization tasks. papers-2015-2025.title: Shared-Memory Parallel Computation of Morse-Smale Complexes with Improved Accuracy
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Topological techniques have proven to be a powerful tool in the analysis and visualization of large-scale scientific data. papers-2015-2025.title: A Study of the Trade-off Between Reducing Precision and Reducing Resolution for Data Analysis and Visualization
papers-2015-2025.abstract: There currently exist two dominant strategies to reduce data sizes in analysis and visualization: reducing the precision of the data, e.g., through quantization, or reducing its resolution, e.g., by subsampling. papers-2015-2025.title: Firefly: Virtual Illumination Drones for Interactive Visualization
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Light specification in three dimensional scenes is a complex problem and several approaches have been presented that aim to automate this process. papers-2015-2025.title: CoDDA: A Flexible Copula-based Distribution Driven Analysis Framework for Large-Scale Multivariate Data
papers-2015-2025.abstract: CoDDA (Copula-based Distribution Driven Analysis) is a flexible framework for large-scale multivariate datasets. papers-2015-2025.abstract: Visualization research often seeks designs that first establish an overview of the data, in accordance to the information seeking mantra: “Overview first, zoom and filter, then details on demand”. papers-2015-2025.title: Exploring Time-Varying Multivariate Volume Data Using Matrix of Isosurface Similarity Maps
papers-2015-2025.abstract: We present a novel visual representation and interface named the matrix of isosurface similarity maps (MISM) for effective exploration of large time-varying multivariate volumetric data sets. papers-2015-2025.title: Visual Analysis of Spatia-temporal Relations of Pairwise Attributes in Unsteady Flow
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Despite significant advances in the analysis and visualization of unsteady flow, the interpretation of it's behavior still remains a challenge. papers-2015-2025.title: Time-Dependent Flow seen through Approximate Observer Killing Fields
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Flow fields are usually visualized relative to a global observer, i.e., a single frame of reference. However, often no global frame can depict all flow features equally well. papers-2015-2025.abstract: Recent advances of 3D acquisition devices have enabled large-scale acquisition of 3D scene data. papers-2015-2025.abstract: In this paper, we present a method for reconstructing the drawing process of Chinese brush paintings. papers-2015-2025.title: Atom: A Grammar for Unit Visualizations
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Unit visualizations are a family of visualizations where every data item is represented by a unique visual mark-a visual unit-during visual encoding. papers-2015-2025.abstract: We present a novel approach to using Bounding Volume Hierarchies (BVHs) for collision detection of volumetric meshes for digital prototyping based on accurate simulation. papers-2015-2025.title: Computer Simulation and Generation of Moving Sand Pictures
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Moving sand pictures are interesting devices that can be used to generate an infinite number of unique scenes when repeatedly being flipped over. papers-2015-2025.abstract: Immersive navigation in virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) leverages physical locomotion through pose tracking of the head-mounted display. papers-2015-2025.abstract: We propose Graph Thumbnails, small icon-like visualisations of the high-level structure of network data. papers-2015-2025.abstract: The aspect ratio of a line chart heavily influences the perception of the underlying data. papers-2015-2025.abstract: Visualization of medical organs and biological structures is a challenging task because of their complex geometry and the resultant occlusions. papers-2015-2025.abstract: Real-time indoor scene reconstruction aims to recover the 3D geometry of an indoor scene in real time with a sensor scanning the scene. papers-2015-2025.abstract: Rendering techniques that increase realism in volume visualization help enhance perception of the 3D features in the volume data. papers-2015-2025.abstract: Visual exploration of flow fields is important for studying dynamic systems. papers-2015-2025.abstract: We propose a novel approach to simulating the formation and evolution of stains on cloths in motion. papers-2015-2025.title: Urban Weathering: Interactive Rendering of Polluted Cities
papers-2015-2025.abstract: Weathering effects are ubiquitous phenomena in cities. Buildings age and deteriorate over time as they interact with the environment. papers-2015-2025.abstract: Transfer function (TF) design is a central topic in direct volume rendering. papers-2015-2025.abstract: This article surveys the history and current state of the art of visualization in meteorology, focusing on visualization techniques and tools used for meteorological data analysis.
